Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide (FSAP) family. Uperin subfamily.
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.10461748] Gram positive bacteria:Bacillus cereus (MIC=25 μg/ml), Leuconostoc lactis  (MIC=3 μg/ml), Listeria innocua (MIC=50 μg/ml), Micrococcus luteus (MIC=50 μg/ml), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC=25 μg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=12 μg/ml), Streptococcus uberis (MIC=12 μg/ml);Gram-negative bacterium:Pasteurella haemolytica (MIC=25 μg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against B.cereus, L.lactis, L.innocua, M.luteus, S.aureus, S.epidermidis and S.uberis.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: Expressed by the skin dorsal glands.

Literature.Title: The solution structure of uperin 3.6, an antibiotic peptide from the granular dorsal glands of the Australian toadlet, Uperoleia mjobergii.
Literature.Author: Chia BC, Carver JA, Mulhern TD, Bowie JH

Literature.Title: New antibiotic uperin peptides from the dorsal glands of the australian toadlet Uperoleia mjobergii.
Literature.Author: Wallace J.C.,Tyler M.J.,Bowie J.H.,Bradford A.M.
